request.description:
##Request Access Token Request an access token from the host using the root administrator account name and password. ##### header Parameters ##### header Parameters | Parameter | Documentation | | ------------ | ------------------ | | Authorization
Required | string
Example:
dXNlcm5hbWU6cGFzc3dvcmQ= | To use the Basic Authentication scheme, include an Authorization header with the value `Basic `. The base64-encoded string should be generated based on username:password. * If you use the Basic Authentication scheme for the Authentication endpoint, the request returns the JSON Web Token in the response body. * If you use the Basic Authentication scheme for other endpoints, the request returns the JSON Web Token in the X-FM-Access-Token field in the response header. * For subsequent API calls, use the Bearer Authentication scheme and include an Authorization header with the value `Bearer `. **Note**: Each time you use the Basic Authentication scheme to get a JSON Web Token, a new API session is created. To avoid having multiple API sessions, use the same JSON Web Token with the Bearer Authentication scheme for all API calls. ### Responses **200 **OK **401 **Unauthorized

## Invalidate Access Token Invalidate the specified JSON Web Token. ##### path Parameters Parameter | Documentation ------------------------ | --------------------------- access_token
required | string
The JSON Web Token.

## Get Server Metadata Get the name, ID, IP address, and version of the Database Server. ##### Header Parameters | Parameter | Description | | --------- | ----------------------------------- | | Authorization
required | string
To use the Basic Authentication scheme, include an Authorization header with the value `Basic `. The base64-encoded string should be generated based on username:password.
* If you use the Basic Authentication scheme for the Authentication endpoint, the request returns the JSON Web Token in the response body.
* If you use the Basic Authentication scheme for other endpoints, the request returns the JSON Web Token in the X-FM-Access-Token field in the response header.
* For subsequent API calls, use the Bearer Authentication scheme and include an Authorization header with the value `Bearer `.

**Note**: Each time you use the Basic Authentication scheme to get a JSON Web Token, a new API session is created. To avoid having multiple API sessions, use the same JSON Web Token with the Bearer Authentication scheme for all API calls. |

## Update Admin Console Account Change the Admin Console account user name and password. ##### Header Parameters | Parameter | Description | | ------------------------- | ----------------------------------------- | | Authorization
required | string
To use the Basic Authentication scheme, include an Authorization header with the value `Basic `. The base64-encoded string should be generated based on username:password.

* If you use the Basic Authentication scheme for the Authentication endpoint, the request returns the JSON Web Token in the response body.
* If you use the Basic Authentication scheme for other endpoints, the request returns the JSON Web Token in the X-FM-Access-Token field in the response header.
* For subsequent API calls, use the Bearer Authentication scheme and include an Authorization header with the value `Bearer `.

**Note**: Each time you use the Basic Authentication scheme to get a JSON Web Token, a new API session is created. To avoid having multiple API sessions, use the same JSON Web Token with the Bearer Authentication scheme for all API calls. | Content-Type
required | string
Value: "application/json"
Only accepts 'application/json'. ##### Request Body schema: application/json Admin Console account parameters | Parameter | Description | | ---------- | ----------- | | newUsername
required | string
New user name for Admin Console. | | newPassword
required | string
New password for Admin Console. | | currentUsername
required | string
Current user name for Admin Console.| | currentPassword
required | string
Current password for Admin Console. | ### Responses | Code | Meaning | | --------- | ------ | | **200 | **OK | | **400 | **Bad Request | | **401 | **Unauthorized |

## Get Server Status Get the Database Server status. ##### Header Parameters | Parameters | Description | | -------------- | ----------------------------------------- | | Authorization
required | string
To use the Basic Authentication scheme, include an Authorization header with the value `Basic `. The base64-encoded string should be generated based on username:password.
* If you use the Basic Authentication scheme for the Authentication endpoint, the request returns the JSON Web Token in the response body.
* If you use the Basic Authentication scheme for other endpoints, the request returns the JSON Web Token in the X-FM-Access-Token field in the response header.
* For subsequent API calls, use the Bearer Authentication scheme and include an Authorization header with the value `Bearer `.

**Note**: Each time you use the Basic Authentication scheme to get a JSON Web Token, a new API session is created. To avoid having multiple API sessions, use the same JSON Web Token with the Bearer Authentication scheme for all API calls. |

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-Powered-By
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter
